snippet.textDisplay: I’m not gonna lie I’m pretty scared of this. Not really with the disease, I’m 25 with no real medical issues. What scares me is the idea of having to quarantine for 2 weeks. I have health insurance and they are offering no pay visits and testing, but I don’t get paid sick leave. I live paycheck to paycheck and being two weeks without work would cripple me. I work in animal healthcare, and with children, and I do Uber and Lyft. I’m just really scared of my life being wrecked by this because I know the government isn’t doing anything about it and my company just told us sick days if we catch it.

snippet.textDisplay:
On October 24, 2009, 
President Barack Obama declared Swine Flu a national emergency in the United States. On November 12,2009, the CDC reported an estimated 22 million Americans had been infected with 2009 AH1N1 and 4,000 Americans had already died when OBama finally declared it a national emergency.
.The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) estimates thatswine flu infected nearly 61 million people in the United States and caused *12,469 deaths*. Worldwide, up to 575,400 people died from pandemic swine flu.
From April 12, 2009 to April 10, 2010, CDC estimated there were 60.8 million cases (range: 43.3-89.3 million), 274,304 hospitalizations (range: 195,086-402,719), and 12,469 deaths (range: 8868-18,306) in the United States due to the (H1N1)pdm09 virus.
President Obama waited over 4,000 Americans had already died from the (H1N1) before he finally declared it an emergency. Today a quick preacted jump on declaring the Corona Virus a emergency and epidemic has already saved countless of thousands of Americans. Still the media and politicians are using this worldwide epidemic as a political stunt. Disgraceful in doing so.
snippet.textOriginal:

.The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) estimates thatswine flu infected nearly 61 million people in the United States and caused *12,469 deaths*. Worldwide, up to 575,400 people died from pandemic swine flu.
From April 12, 2009 to April 10, 2010, CDC estimated there were 60.8 million cases (range: 43.3-89.3 million), 274,304 hospitalizations (range: 195,086-402,719), and 12,469 deaths (range: 8868-18,306) in the United States due to the (H1N1)pdm09 virus.
President Obama waited over 4,000 Americans had already died from the (H1N1) before he finally declared it an emergency.  Today a quick preacted jump on declaring the Corona Virus a emergency and epidemic has already saved countless of thousands of Americans. Still the media and politicians are using this worldwide epidemic as a political stunt. Disgraceful in doing so.

snippet.textDisplay:
As a Chinese, this is what I did every day last month😂.
Don't go to crowds 🙏（Distance above 1.5 meters).
Reduce the number and time of going out🙏
Wear a mask if you have😷. Ordinary medical surgical masks are just fine👌. People who are not in the hospital do not need N95 masks and don't waste medical resources😱.
Disinfect your coat after going out🤔.
You can carry a vial of cleaner -- containing at least 60 percent alcohol with you👍.
Don't touch your face🙀.
Stay optimistic. In fact, I have survived because of this.
✧*｡٩(ˊωˋ*)و✧*｡
Stay strong. Do your job well and don't burden doctors. Don't panic, because we've overcome the hardest time, you can too.
snippet.textOriginal:
As a Chinese, this is what I did every day last month😂.
Don't go to crowds 🙏（Distance above 1.5 meters). 
Reduce the number and time of going out🙏
Wear a mask if you have😷. Ordinary medical surgical masks are just fine👌.  People who are not in the hospital do not need N95 masks and don't waste medical resources😱.
Disinfect your coat after going out🤔.  
You can carry a vial of  cleaner -- containing at least 60 percent alcohol with you👍.  
Don't touch your face🙀.
Stay optimistic. In fact, I have survived because of this. 
✧*｡٩(ˊωˋ*)و✧*｡
Stay strong. Do your job well and don't burden doctors. Don't panic, because we've overcome the hardest time, you can too.

snippet.textDisplay:
Doctor Mike a few weeks ago: "Remember guys the flu kills more people."

Doctor Mike now: "People need to stop saying that the coronavirus is just a flu."

China has been lying as they have in the past about SARS and the medical experts at the WHO covered for China. Trust is a two way street. You cannot tell us to trust medical experts, when medical experts INCLUDING YOURSELF lie to us. I don't want a panic either but stop trying to put this on the general population. Surgeon General saying don't use masks they don't work but we need them for medical staff is pretty flipping transparent Mike. That is a government error not the fault of the general public that they were completely unprepared when preparation was the job of the CDC and WHO. The medical community lied and burned any credibility they had to protect China and the global market. We reap what you sow Doctor Mike. Running interference for them may help calm the herd, but it doesn't make you less of a scumbag. The medical field has been all over the place on their assessments on what is going on and that's the fault of the media? Really?

Seriously screw yourself Mike when you frame this as a failure of the general public. Your fans need to go back to watching Dr. Oz sell them miracle weight loss supplements.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey Dr. Mike, can you release an updated video? So many places are quarantined, there are only so many confirmed cases, but it is also insanely difficult to obtain test kits. There is so much fear circulating. People are cancelling their travel plans. People are worried about catching this virus and dying as a result. Even though it appears as though recovery is very probable if you are a healthy individual.People are stockpiling stuff like paper products, hand soap, disinfecting products, hand sanitizers... We're preparing at my hospital for an influx of airborne precautions by testing our ability to utilize an entire hallway as a negative pressure room. I've been telling people not to worry and carry about their business, just to ensure that they are washing their hands, sanitizing surfaces and avoiding sick contacts, but is that enough? Should we truly be quarantining ourselves in our homes if co-vid 19 truly is airborne? WPS says our area is not high-risk yet the local college is extending spring break and trying to work out how to do things online. Some more information about the status of states besides Wisconsin and what doctors that have handled numerous cases are saying, if there has been any research on the virus, what that research is saying. I just want some straight-forward answers. Not sensationalized information that I find myself having to weed through.
snippet.textOriginal: Hey Dr. Mike, can you release an updated video? So many places are quarantined, there are only so many confirmed cases, but it is also insanely difficult to obtain test kits. There is so much fear circulating. People are cancelling their travel plans. People are worried about catching this virus and dying as a result. Even though it appears as though recovery is very probable if you are a healthy individual.People are stockpiling stuff like paper products, hand soap, disinfecting products, hand sanitizers... We're preparing at my hospital for an influx of airborne precautions by testing our ability to utilize an entire hallway as a negative pressure room. I've been telling people not to worry and carry about their business, just to ensure that they are washing their hands, sanitizing surfaces and avoiding sick contacts, but is that enough? Should we truly be quarantining ourselves in our homes if co-vid 19 truly is airborne? WPS says our area is not high-risk yet the local college is extending spring break and trying to work out how to do things online. Some more information about the status of states besides Wisconsin and what doctors that have handled numerous cases are saying, if there has been any research on the virus, what that research is saying. I just want some straight-forward answers. Not sensationalized information that I find myself having to weed through.

snippet.textDisplay: The US did a good job when they acted, however, they acted too late. In mid-January, when I first read about this outbreak it was only in china and a couple cases in South Korea and Thailand. I vividly remember reading and saying out loud to myself "This is gonna be really bad"... Since then, it's been a nightmare. The US acted too late. Its too little, too late. Had they started taking precautions earlier, we would not be in this situation right now.
snippet.textOriginal: The US did a good job when they acted, however, they acted too late. In mid-January, when I first read about this outbreak it was only in china and a couple cases in South Korea and Thailand. I vividly remember reading and saying out loud to myself "This is gonna be really bad"... Since then, it's been a nightmare. The US acted too late. Its too little, too late. Had they started taking precautions earlier, we would not be in this situation right now.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi Dr. Mike, how about aerosol machines?
I have heard a lot how about 10% of the cases get heavy lung symptoms and respiratory problems that need intensive care (which is the reason for the need of containment to not overload the system), but no actual details about the symptoms or the intensive care itself.
Will standard aerosol machine drops, like broncodilators, timian, etc, used to soften mucus, idrate lungs, etc work on these symptoms? Can they avoid the need for hospital intensive care? And if yes, could they be used to relieve the stress on the healthcare system by putting them in electric cigarettes, which are widely available?
